title: Keeping SQLite happy on servers
content:
SQLite likes predictable writes, so I batch non-critical updates and keep journaling in WAL mode. Backups are just file copies with a short lock, then rsync to cold storage.

I monitor for long-running queries with a tiny cron job that dumps `sqlite3` stats to a text file. Anything suspicious gets fixed before it becomes a problem.

This approach keeps the stack small: no external DB to babysit, no migrations waiting for a window. Just a single file that moves with the code.
